text: Apple reported year-over-year revenue changes driven primarily by iPhone and Services. Management cited foreign exchange headwinds and supply normalization. Gross margin improvements were attributed to a richer product mix.
Services revenue achieved an all-time high, supported by App Store and cloud. Wearables moderated year-over-year after elevated prior-year demand.
Microsoft highlighted cloud revenue growth led by Azure. Operating margin expanded due to efficiency and higher gross margin in cloud services.
NVIDIA gross margin increased year-over-year, reflecting a mix shift to data center products. Management referenced supply dynamics and demand for accelerated computing.
Quarterly commentary indicated continued investment in R&D and inventory purchases aligned with demand outlook.
